summary.para: The exception that is thrown when the value of an argument is outside the allowable range of values as defined by the invoked method.

content.para: ArgumentOutOfRangeException is thrown when a method is invoked and at least one of the arguments passed to the method is not null and does not contain a valid value.
T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException is used extensively by:

listItem.para: Classes in the N:System.Collections and N:System.IO namespaces.

content.para: ArgumentOutOfRangeException behaves identically to T:System.ArgumentException. It is provided so that application code can differentiate between exceptions caused by invalid arguments that are not null, and exceptions caused by null arguments. For errors caused by null arguments, see T:System.ArgumentNullException.
T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException uses the HRESULT COR_E_ARGUMENTOUTOFRANGE, which has the value 0x80131502.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException, see the T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException constructors.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException class.
Initializes a new instance of the T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException class.

content.para: This constructor initializes the P:System.ArgumentException.Message property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "Nonnegative number required." This message takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException.

entry.para: A null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException class.
Initializes a new instance of the T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException class with serialized data.

content.para: The object that holds the serialized object data.
An object that describes the source or destination of the serialized data.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream. For more information, see [<topic://cpconSerialization>].

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException class with the name of the parameter that causes this exception.

content.para: The name of the parameter that causes this exception.

This constructor initializes the P:System.ArgumentException.Message property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "Nonnegative number required." This message takes into account the current system culture.
This constructor initializes the P:System.ArgumentException.ParamName property of the new instance using the paramName parameter. The content of paramName is intended to be understood by humans.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException.

entry.para: A null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException class with a specified error message and the exception that is the cause of this exception.

content.para: The error message that explains the reason for this exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no inner exception is specified.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException class with a specified error message, the parameter name, and the value of the argument.

content.para: The name of the parameter that caused the exception.
The value of the argument that causes this exception.
The message that describes the error.

This constructor initializes the P:System.ArgumentException.ParamName property of the new instance using the paramName parameter, the P:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException.ActualValue property using the actualValue parameter, and the P:System.ArgumentException.Message property using the message parameter. The content of the paramName and message parameters is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that these strings have been localized for the current system culture.

The actualValue parameter is not used within the .NET Framework class library. However, the P:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException.ActualValue property is provided so that applications can use the available argument value.

The actualValue parameter contains an invalid value that is passed to the method and causes this exception to be thrown. This value is stored in the P:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException.ActualValue property and its string representation is appended to the message string held in the P:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException.Message property.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException.

entry.para: The null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException class with a specified error message and the name of the parameter that causes this exception.

content.para: The name of the parameter that caused the exception.
The message that describes the error.

This constructor initializes the P:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException.Message property of the new instance using the value of the message parameter. The content of the message parameter is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
This constructor initializes the P:System.ArgumentException.ParamName property of the new instance using the paramName parameter. The content of paramName is intended to be understood by humans.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException.

summary.para: Sets the T:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo object with the invalid argument value and additional exception information.

content.para: The object that holds the serialized object data.
An object that describes the source or destination of the serialized data.
The info object is null.

M:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException.GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext) sets a T:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo object with all the exception object data targeted for serialization. During deserialization, the exception object is reconstituted from the T:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo transmitted over the stream.
For more information, see T:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo.

summary.para: Gets the argument value that causes this exception.

returnValue.para: An Object that contains the value of the parameter that caused the current T:System.Exception.

content.para: Use this property to retrieve the invalid argument.
The ActualValue property returns the same value that was passed to the constructor, or null if no value was supplied.

The P:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException.ActualValue property is assigned a value at the time of object construction. If the P:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException.ActualValue property value is not null, a string representation of the value is appended to the message string held by the P:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException.Message property.

The P:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException.ActualValue property is not used within the .NET Framework class library. It carries a null value in all the T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException objects thrown by the .NET Framework class library. The P:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException.ActualValue property is provided so that applications can use the available argument value.
This property is read-only and should be overridden only to customize the content or format of the value.

summary.para: Gets the error message and the string representation of the invalid argument value, or only the error message if the argument value is null.

returnValue.para: The text message for this exception. The value of this property takes one of two forms, as follows.

entry.para: The message string passed to the constructor.
The message string appended with the string representation of the invalid argument value.

content.para: This property overrides P:System.ArgumentException.Message.
The error message should describe the expected values of the parameter that causes this exception. The error message should be localized.
